This article is a modified version of the paper presented on April 14, 1988, in Jerusalem at the symposium "The Chomskyan Turn." The authors gratefully acknowledge the support for work on the paper provided by the Van Leer Foundation, Jerusalem, the Center for Cognitive Science, MIT, and the Center for the Study of Language and Information, Stanford University. For critical discussion and advice we are indebted to N

We deliberately eschew in this discussion the use of "declarative rules" and "procedural rules" in characterizing the differences between syntax/semantics on the one hand and phonology on the other hand. That terminology, which carries a number of associations from the domain of computational linguistics, strikes us as unhelpful
